item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's Starting Horse Has a Powerful Secret Perk
item.description:
Summary

  • Pebbles, the starting horse in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, has a secret perk that boosts her stats significantly.
  • Players loyal to Pebbles can unlock the perk by riding her for over 35km, enhancing her speed, stamina, and value.
  • Herring, which is a horse that can be obtained at Trosky Castle, also has a secret stat-increasing perk, but players must ride the horse for over 50km.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 players are just realizing that Pebbles (the game's starting horse) has a secret perk that drastically increases her stats, making her one of the best horses in the game. While Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 players can easily steal one of the many horses scattered around Trosky or Kuttenberg, a large portion of the community has remained dedicated to Pebbles the horse, despite her rather lackluster stats. Thankfully, there is one secret perk that allows players to remain loyal and also have a great horse to traverse around the Kingdom of Bohemia.

The vast and detailed world of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is filled with easter eggs, quests, loot, and so much more. With so many different adventures to be had around Trosky, plenty of players are putting hours and hours into the massive RPG before they even make it to the wedding in Semine, which is where Henry is reunited with his trusty horse Pebbles. Although her stats are far from great, owning a horse allows for much faster travel and rids of the danger that comes with having to constantly steal horses. Initially, it seemed like the only real reason to stay with Pebbles was loyalty, but it looks like there is a secret perk that increases her value, speed, stamina, and more.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Players Can Increase Pebbles' Stats With Secret Perk

When players eventually make it to Trosky Castle, one of the main quests will present Henry with a difficult decision and force Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 players to choose between Pebbles and Herring. At first glance, this might seem like an easy decision, as Herring has far superior stats when compared to Pebbles. Herring has a higher stamina rating, increased speed, courage, and a much higher value. However, as players have now started to realize (thanks, PCGamer), Pebbles' stats can actually be upgraded with a secret perk. If players remain loyal to Pebbles and ride her for more than 35km, the perk "Good Old Pebbles" will be unlocked and drastically increase her stats.

Pebbles (Without Perk)

Pebbles (With Perk)

Stamina

127

210

Carrying Capacity

138

293

Speed

32

43

Courage

12

12

Value

100

4,140

For those who might have already traded in Pebbles for Herring at Trosky Castle, there is a way to get her back. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 players simply need to head to Semine and re-purchase Pebbles from the horse keeper. However, it is worth noting that Herring (the horse that can be obtained from Trosky Castle) also has a secret perk similar to Good Old Pebbles. While players will need to travel on Pebbles for over 35km to increase her stats, Herring has a perk called "Red Herring" that requires players to travel over 50km, which is substantially further and doesn't come with a massive improvement over Pebbles. The Red Herring perk has slightly better stamina and speed than Good Old Pebbles, with every other stat remaining the same or worse.

With so much to do in Warhose Studios' smash hit sequel, it's no surprise that Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 continues to smash through sales records. The studio recently revealed that the RPG had surpassed two million copies sold in just two weeks. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has also received rave reviews from both critics and players, currently boasting a "very positive" review badge on Steam with over 35,000 reviews.

item.title: The Sims 4: Complete Guide | Tips, Packs, Careers, Skills, Scenarios, & More
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Beginner Tips
  • The Sims 4: Base Game Complete Guides
  • Pack Guides (Expansion Packs, Game Packs, Stuff Packs, Kits)

    • Game Pack Complete Guides

The Sims 4 is a hugely popular life simulation video game series developed by Maxis and published by Electronic Arts. It is the fourth major installment in The Sims series and was released on September 2, 2014. The game focuses on creating and controlling virtual people called “Sims” and their lives in a simulated environment. The Sims 4 allows players to customize their Sims’ appearances and personalities while also constructing and furnishing their own homes. The game also provides players with a wide range of activities and skills to pursue, such as building relationships, taking part in careers, designing their own clothing and furniture, and much more.

RELATED:The Unwritten Rules of the Sims Explained

With so much to explore in The Sims 4 , it can be easy to miss out on some of the amazing features the game has to offer. That's why we created this complete guide - to help players discover all the information and resources they need to get the most out of their Sims 4 experience, whether just getting started or seasoned veterans. As the game continues to expand, this page will be continually updated to ensure that it remains up-to-date.

Updated on February 18, 2025, by Elara Leclair: With the exciting release of recent expansion packs like Life and Death and Lovestruck and Business & Hobbies just around the corner, The Sims 4 is bursting with even more fun activities and adventures for players to explore. With so much new content, it’s easy to overlook some features or not know how to make the most out of certain functions. This comprehensive guide has been updated to include the latest base game updates and expansion pack guides, along with additional tips and walkthroughs. These updates are designed to help Simmers navigate their gameplay with ease and ensure they don’t miss out on any of the enriching experiences that The Sims 4 has to offer.

  • Beginner Tips

    This section is for players that are just starting out with The Sims 4. Here, players will find information on the basics of controls and gameplay, so that they can get started quickly and easily.

  • The Sims 4: Base Game Complete Guides


    The Sims 4 Base Game has been free-to-play since October 18th, making it even more accessible to players. At launch in 2014, the Base Game may not have offered as much content as some players had hoped for, but with many updates over the years, it can now be enjoyed as an incredibly rich and immersive gaming experience – even without having to own any paid content. This section provides the information players need to know about the Base Game, and all the activities they can enjoy while playing it.

  • Pack Guides (Expansion Packs, Game Packs, Stuff Packs, Kits)


    Expansion packs for The Sims 4 offer the most comprehensive content updates, introducing a variety of new gameplay features, objects, clothes, styles, worlds, and life states that all revolve around a particular theme. In comparison to full expansion packs, Game packs are typically much smaller. On the other hand, Stuff Packs and Kits are small, downloadable add-on packs that typically don't provide much in terms of gameplay additions but rather offer new CAS and building items. This section provides full guides to each pack and details the exciting new features they offer.

As the main way of making money in Sims 4, careers have a significant impact on a sim's day-to-day life. Aiming for promotions can be beneficial, as they come with rewards, including unlockable items, and a pay increase. item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - How to Farm Survival XP
item.description:
The Survival skill is a general measurement of Henry's ability to live off what nature provides in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 . A higher Survival skill means you get to enjoy better yields from hunting and foraging, and you'll be able to use your knowledge to help other people as well.

Hunting animals and picking flowers isn't exactly the main selling point of this game, but if you're looking to build the best Henry possible in KCD2 , you'll need to pay attention to your Survival XP gains. Here are the best ways to level this skill up.

Quick Links

  • How to Level Up Survival in KCD2
    • Which Method Should You Use?

How to Level Up Survival in KCD2

You can get Survival XP by doing nature-related things, namely gathering herbs, hunting animals, and processing the resources you get from them . Picking up any useful herb or killing and skinning an animal will net you small amounts of Survival XP, and while spending a few days doing nothing but hunting and gathering sounds tempting, you'll want to process the stuff you've collected to get more XP.

Herbs are processed by hanging them on drying racks. Apothecaries usually have a drying rack on or near their property , and you can freely use them as much as you want. Not only does drying herbs give you more Survival XP, but you'll also preserve the herbs themselves, keeping them from spoiling over time.

Using dried herbs for potions will reduce the quality of your end product. If you're worried about this, take the Dark Arts Apprentice perk and only brew at night.

The same principle applies if you cook, smoke, or dry meat in KCD2. If you're concerned about food preservation, dry your food instead of cooking or smoking them — they'll offer less nutrition and other bonuses, but they'll never spoil. Also, keep in mind that poaching is illegal , so if you get caught carrying animal meat, be prepared to fight or talk your way out.

The bigger the animal you kill, the more XP you'll get. If you find a stag while exploring the wilderness, you might want to take it down, as it killing and harvesting it rewards about 100 Survival XP.

The best place to hunt any animal is on an established Hunting Ground. Check your map to see if you've discovered any.

Which Method Should You Use?

We recommend going the herb farming route since it's simpler and less risky. Picking flowers requires no skill, and people won't get mad at you even if you pick herbs from their own gardens (such is the case in the Troskowitz apothecary). The glades behind Bozhena's hut and the one near Nebakov (the same place where you get to romance Klara) has a lot of flowers that are ripe for the picking.

Bring a bow or crossbow with you whenever you go out for herbs. If a deer or stag approaches, take the time to hunt it for even more XP.

item.title: Animal Crossing Fan's Mom Has a Stunning Number of Nook Miles
item.description:
Summary

  • A player's mother amassed an impressive 852,490 Nook Miles in Animal Crossing: New Horizons.
  • The game was a hit in 2020 during the pandemic and remains the second best-selling title on the Nintendo Switch.
  • Nook Miles can be exchanged for items and tickets, with players sharing impressive saving achievements.

An Animal Crossing: New Horizons player has shared the extraordinary amount of Nook Miles their mother has collected within the game, and the community was stunned by the impressive saving. Nook Miles are a type of currency in New Horizons , and Tom Nook initially explains to island dwellers that 5,000 Nook Miles must be saved to cover their tent and initial move-in fees. The currency can also be redeemed at the Nook Stop terminal in exchange for a range of items, capabilities, and recipes.

The social simulation game is the fifth main entry in the series, set on a desert island and run by Tom Nook with a host of anthropomorphic animals as neighbors. The game was a huge hit and comfort to gamers during the pandemic in 2020 and remains the second best-selling title on the Nintendo Switch console. New Horizons publisher Nintendo has been making waves in the industry by recently pushing Switch 2 hype out to the masses, and fans have already compiled a wish list for Nintendo’s April Direct showcase, which includes a new Animal Crossing game.

Posted on Reddit by linnibeanie, a screenshot of New Horizons ’ menu was shared in the Animal Crossing subreddit. The poster explained their mother was visiting, and the pair were playing New Horizons together, revealing the amount of Nook Miles their mother had managed to accumulate, similar to a 50-year-old Animal Crossing player who recently reached the Nook Miles cap. The fan’s mother had raked up an impressive 852,490 Nook Miles, which is an incredible amount to turn any player’s island into the space of their dreams.

Animal Crossing Fan Shares Their Mother's Incredible Nook Miles Savings in New Horizons

Animal Crossing: New Horizons players need to know a few essentials before redeeming Nook Miles tickets, but the amount of diverse items on offer in the game is enough to make any player’s island an experience to remember. One Redditor commented on the mother’s Nook Miles saving, saying they thought their 386k was impressive, and another user claimed their grandmother had saved 2.5 million Nook Miles.

Nook Miles can be collected in New Horizons by completing various activities around the island, and this currency can then be exchanged for tickets and items to decorate players’ islands. There are several ways to gain Nook Miles Tickets fast in Animal Crossing: New Horizons , including arranging island visits during high turnip prices for Nook Miles exchanges and selling unwanted items and recipes to players for Nook Miles.

item.title: Avowed: Every Level 5 Spell For Wizards, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Level 5 spells in Avowed are powerful, such as Grimoire Snap, Bristling Frost, and Crackling Bolt for various uses.
  • Wizards in Avowed can utilize passive abilities like Wand Mastery, Bounce, and Blast, enhancing their spellcasting skills.
  • Spells like Fireball and Blizzard offer impactful abilities for one-on-one encounters and area-of-effect attacks, respectively.

Level one for the Wizard class is quite stacked in Avowed . Players can unlock seven spells to torture enemies along with an armor-based passive ability. Level five for Wizards in Avowed is less stacked but there are some strong conjurings.

There are more passive abilities in Avowed , too. Wand Mastery will increase the damage Wand-based weapons do. Bounce will reflect Wand magic off of foes and Blast will make more of an impact when players charge their Wands. Finally, Grimoire Mastery is needed to unlock the following five spells so it is a must. That said, these Wizard spells will be ranked based on power and usefulness.

5 Grimoire Snap

A Librarian’s Greatest Power

  • Cost: 35 Essence
  • Cooldown: 20 Seconds

Grimoire Snap is an odd spell as it can use an equipped book to slam shut. This will cause the area to erupt in a wave of damage. It’s a good spell to use if players are surrounded by enemies but it doesn’t carry the same magical essence in Avowed as the other level five spells or even some of the level one spells.

That said, Grimoires are some of the best weapons in the game. They come equipped with four spells and players don’t need to use ability points in Avowed ’s skill tree to use them. They are user-friendly and rare, so if one comes up, be sure to give it a read even if players don’t unlock Grimoire Snap.

4 Bristling Frost

Command The Oceans With Your Icy Step

  • Cost: 40 Essence
  • Duration: 20 Seconds
  • Cooldown: 20 Seconds

Bristling Frost is a more versatile spell than Grimoire Snap and it's one of the best spells in the overall game no matter the level attached. Casting Bristling Frost will engulf the player in a chilly aura which will boost defense similar to the level one spell, Arcane Veil. The difference is that enemies who come close will be damaged. It will be light, but any extra damage players can apply during combat is always welcome in an action RPG.

Players can also use Bristling Frost to freeze water in Avowed . Any ice-based spell can freeze water or enemies if enough ice magic is applied. Bristling Frost is special though because players don’t have to cast it at water to freeze it. For example, if players are exploring a beach, they can simply start walking on water and the ocean below will freeze as if players were performing a feat akin to Jesus before his followers. The one downside is that players can’t cast Bristling Frost and then jump into the water as that will result in a dive so there are limitations.

3 Crackling Bolt

Bounce Lightning Balls Between Foes

  • Cost: 50 Essence
  • Cooldown: 15 Seconds

Crackling Bolt is like an upgrade to the first-level spell, Jolting Touch. Instead of shooting stream-like jolts of lightning akin to Emperor Palatine from Star Wars , players will shoot an electric ball in Avowed. This ball will ping pong around the battlefield and hit anyone it comes across. In open spaces, this spell is weak as it can often just shoot into space as if to say “I’m free!”

Crackling Bolt is best used then indoors like a building or a cave. Upgrades will give players more chances to hit enemies with the electric orbs. Compared to Jolting Touch, it’s trickier to use but technically stronger. To note, if electric magic touches water, all enemies in that water will be electrocuted. It’s another example of how spells interact with Avowed ’s environments more than other magic systems in RPGs.

2 Fireball

Good For One On One Encounters

  • Cost: 50 Essence
  • Cooldown: 15 Seconds

Fireball is a standard spell for an RPG and honestly, it can look boring upon first impact. It’s not flashy like the level one fire spell, Fan of Flames, but Fireball is a lot stronger against one enemy. The more it gets upgraded, the bigger the impact will be on surrounding enemies. If players dump enough points into it, Fireball can explode like a meteor.

The best part of the spell even on the first tier is the summoning animation which looks like the player is launching a Hadouken from Street Fighter . Fireball is a work in progress for group attacks, but it’s an ace in the hole for bosses provided players can aim well. A steady hand will always win the war.

1 Blizzard

Rain Ice Down From The Heavens

  • Cost: 50 Essence
  • Duration: 3 Seconds
  • Cooldown: 15 Seconds

Blizzard is an upgrade to Chill Blades which is a level one spell. Chill Blades launched a bunch of icy daggers forward at enemies. Blizzard instead will summon a cloud of icicles to rain down from above on a selected spot for a limited time. With the right direction, players can cover a lot of enemies.

Almost every spell in the game can be guided provided players hold down the summoning button first. That’s an extra tip for those struggling to be the very best wizard or witch players can be. Upgraded, Blizzard can look like a typical day in February for Minnesotans. It has a high chance to freeze enemies too so topping off this spell with a flaming Fireball would be a one-two icy hot combo like no other.
